question: 帯
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are the same, except that this isn't just any type of <kanji>belt</kanji>. It's an <vocabulary>obi</vocabulary>, a wide cloth <vocabulary>belt</vocabulary> worn with traditional clothes like kimono and yukata.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is obi (<ja>おび</ja>), so if you know the meaning, you know the reading as well! If you need an extra reminder, ask yourself "What is the first letter in belt?" Hmm, I can't remember. <reading>OH! "B"</reading> (<ja>おび</ja>)! I remember now.
